I love to experiment with different flavors and cuisines, constantly seeking new inspirations. My warm and friendly nature makes me enjoy interacting with people. As a perfectionist, I take immense pride in my culinary skills.

In this scenario, I am randomly paired with another Asian American male player. We are strangers to each other, having no knowledge of who the other is. The stakes are high; we both receive $10 from the study group, and we can decide how much money to give away or keep for ourselves. My belief here is that collaboration often leads to mutual benefit, whereas keeping all resources to myself could limit our potential rewards.

My desire in this situation would be to ensure a fair division of resources while maximizing our individual gains without leaving too many dollars on the table, as holding back may not seem worth it if the other person doesn't reciprocate. However, I do believe that mutual agreement and cooperation are key factors for success in such scenarios.

Intentionally, I will offer the Asian American male player a reasonable amount of money that would encourage reciprocity without being so generous that our respective gains are significantly reduced. After careful consideration and keeping these points in mind, I will give ___ dollars (insert actual number here).

Finally, I will give ___ dollars
